DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for colon and rectal neuroendocrine tumor based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor Clinical M Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A well differentiated, low or intermediate grade tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A well differentiated, low or intermediate grade tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum.

Concepts.definition: A well differentiated, low, intermediate, or high grade neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System

ValueDomain.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Clinical M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of a colorectal neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor pM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with both hepatic and extrahepatic metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with both hepatic and extrahepatic metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis in at least one extrahepatic site (e.g., lung, ovary, nonregional lymph node, peritoneum, bone). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis in at least one extrahepatic site (e.g., lung, ovary, nonregional lymph node, peritoneum, bone). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis confined to liver. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with metastasis confined to liver. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor cM0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Colorectal neuroendocrine tumor without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
